g:Label.text: In order to use topcat it must be configured to point to one or more icat servers.
Adding an Icat
1) Click on the add button, this will present you with a form to complete.
2) Enter a name for the facility, this is the name that gets presented to the users.
3) Select the version number of the icat that you are going to connect to.
4) Enter the URL of the icat server (including the protocol http:// or https://) e.g. https://example.com
5) Optionally select a bespoke search plugin to associate with the facility, currently plugins exist for DLS and ISIS.
6) Optionally select a download plugin in order to download files (only ids 1.0.0 is currently supported).
7) If a download plugin is selected you must provide the URL of the download server (including the protocol http:// or https://)e.g. https://hostname:port
8) Save the information.
The next step is to associate one or more authentication plugins with the icat server.
1) Click on the Show Auth. Details button.
2) Click on the add button that has just popped up. This will present you with another form to complete.

3) Enter a display name. If you are providing more than one type of authentication the user will be presented with the list of display names to select from. You should therefore ensure that the display names are meaningful to the user.
4) Select the appropriate authentication service type.
5) Optionally provide a URL of the authentication service.
6) Save the information.
7) Add additional authentication details as required.
External Redirect Authentication

The external redirect authentication plugin redirects the user to a url that you specifify. The plugin appends to the url the query parameter service= which contains information on the facility to login and authentication type in addition to the last requested url. Your authentication system after a successful login should redirect to the service url with the icat sessionId appended to a ticket= parameter. e.g https://localhost:8181/TOPCATWeb.jsp?facilityName=isis&authenticationType=external+redirect&url=https%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A8181%2FTOPCATWeb.jsp%23view%2F%2F%2F%40tab%3DAllData&ticket=ICAT_SESSIONID
Testing Connections
Ping functions have been provided to test that services are listening on the given URLs. This gives no guarantee that the remote service is functioning correctly.
